definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
hammer/to hammer into shape/weight (e.g. of a steelyard or balance)/to strike with a hammer

sentences.english: How is the hammer of the whole earth cut asunder and broken!
sentences.chinese: 全地的大锤何竟砍断破坏。

sentences.english: though they went after my safe with a sledgehammer, they'd failed to open it.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他们动用大锤，也没有打开我的保险柜。

sentences.english: If a jeweler's hammer isn't strong enough to chip off our rough edges, God will use a sledgehammer.
sentences.chinese: 若首饰匠的细锤无法除去我们的棱角，神便动用大锤。

sentences.english: The conjurer threw the watch into the mortar and grasped a sledgehammer from the table.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师把表扔进臼里，从桌子上拿起一把大锤。

sentences.english: Mushu went outside and hit the Great Stone Dragon with his gong.
sentences.chinese: 木须走到外面，用大锤重重的敲大石龙。

definition: hammer/to hammer into shape/weight (e.g. of a steelyard or balance)/to strike with a hammer
mace (weapon)/see 銅錘花臉|铜锤花脸[tong2 chui2 hua1 lian3]
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
ancient spear-like weapon with a wavy spearhead like a snake's body
golden cudgel, weapon wielded by Sun Wukong in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
